messages.subject: FW: End of Probation & Sales Review Minutes  FIRST DRAFT
messages.body:
Jack,



I hope you are well and thanks for your time earlier this week, hopefully we got some clarity on the expectations moving forward but let me once again confirm we are absolutely committed to supporting you to deliver success moving forward. I have asked Matt to provide an overview of the meeting, so we are clear on what was discussed. If he has missed anything or you disagree let me know.





Date: 27th February 2024



Present:



Jack Parker

Jason Mayor

Matt Jackson





Agenda



 * Call Report Overview
 * Current Lead Lists/Pipeline
 * Partner Pipeline
 * SSGB Progress
 * Training Requirements
 * Support Requirements
 * End of Probation
 * AOB







 1. Current Partnership Pipeline



JM  If you can provide an overview of where we are currently up to?



JP  5 more or less ready to go, Royal Sped (Hungary) registrations are all complete etc IPARLA/RONCO for Spain/France and also the broker in Germany who can complete the personal effects and also complete in CZ.



MJ  Also mentioned that the Polish broker is also setup and ready to go.



JM  14th March we have a board meeting with Stena and we are required to provide a further update by the end of this current week.



Action  Provide JM full overview of the current partnership pipeline with an overview on each. Moving forward we need to deliver 9 new(inc current ones) partners and set up a formal onboarding process, so the CustomsLink Team and the wider business understand the processes, SLAs and any KPIs. We also need to establish the potential of reciprocal business envisaged.



 2. Current Lead List/Pipeline



JP  Explained current pipeline, explained warm, active, inactive and cold lists.



JM  Talk further about active, what have the volumes been so far from the four active customers.



MJ  So far only HT Ferry have traded with declarations and 1 transit, way short of the anticipated volumes.



JP  Explained none of the others have traded yet.



JM  Ill be honest here JP this pipeline isnt great, and we need to see more even on the warm list if you take away Gerlach there isnt much on there.



JP  Explained that it isnt fantastic, and it needs to see and improvement with the amount in this pipeline.



JM  Lets have a look at the call reports which I receive for everybody, if you look at this you dont speak to be speaking with many potential customers.



JP  Agreed I havent made as many calls as I should have, and I will make more calls going forward.



Action  A real focus on sales activity with a concentration on phone calls and face to face meetings. Most of the activity is email based now and whilst this can be an effective form of new business development to gain a better understanding of requirement and build a better relationship direct contact is required.



Current targets  to deliver 650 declarations per month - 5000 bonus paid annually.



In addition, for every 1000 extra declarations achieved over 7800 decs per annum JP to receive 1000 additional bonus (based on 15 selling price declaration - for larger customers we will work on the profit per dec to calculate the bonus per 1000 declarations).





 3. S&S GB Progress





JM  Any progress so far on S&SGB?



JP  Still early days as initial call was only last week but roughly around 300 hauliers have been identified.



Action  JP to continue with current work agreed in the SSGB Review with a meeting to discuss progress in 2 weeks. If JP requires any support to reach out to ensure action deadlines are met.





 4. Training & Support Requirements



JM  If there is anything we can do to support you, please speak up we are here to help.

JP  No direct support currently needed apart from smaller demo reviews  MJ offered internal assistance(see below).



Action  None required but JP to highlight any support or training requirements.





 5. End of Probation



JM  We are coming up to the end of your probationary period and whilst the pipeline isnt great we will pass your probationary period but this pipeline has to improve in the coming months. We absolutely believe you are the right person to for CustomsLink. If there is anything else we can do to support you please speak up.



JP  I would like more breathing space, if we look at Aldi talks nobody has got too exited about this one this is ideal and hopefully we can deliver. I have also been chasing up leads that other people have been working on, examples provided include John on Reload and Joe from Sales regarding the ATA carnets. Furthermore, completing the demos are taking too much of my time up, I can be waiting 20-30 minutes and then nobody turns up.

JM - Agree to support in these areas and will discuss with JG and the UK FL Sales Team to provide clearer communication.



MJ  Mentioned you look at those inbound demo bookings and take your pick of what can/cant do and if your time is best spent elsewhere speak with Tracey and ask if Mel can complete.



JP  Ok will do that would help.



JM  Any further comments from you MJ?



MJ  I completely echo what JM has said, I enjoy working with you but improvements must be made going forward to see an increase in the pipeline.





 6. AOB



Nothing else to discuss.





As outlined, we are committed to supporting you and I have attached the successful completion of your probation letter for use with your mortgage supplier. I am convinced that with extra focus you can achieve but as outlined we need to see marked improvement.



If we have missed anything or you have any feedback, please let me know.



Keep at it, the next big win is just around the corner!



Thanks



Jay.

T:01772 282 592

W:freightlink.co.uk

A:Quarry Bank, Chorley Road, Preston, PR5 4JN, UK.





Jason Mayor

Assistant Managing Director

Date: Friday, 2 June 2023 at 08:52
To: Mark Stephens <mark@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: RE: Freightlink Development & support contract (F-MIS9/159)

Hi Mark



I hope that youre well and have had a good week.



Im just following up on the below and wondered whether you had had the opportunity to consider my proposal and whether you considered the retainer to reflect a more cost effective and beneficial option at this stage.



I look forward to hearing from you.



Many thanks

John



John Pickervance

Partner, Head of Commercial

T: DD 0333 207 1134 M 07976 257777

E: john.pickervance@forbessolicitors.co.uk

Web: www.forbessolicitors.co.uk

Twitter: @forbessolicitor







From: John Pickervance
Sent: Friday, May 26, 2023 9:44 AM
To: 'Mark Stephens' <mark@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: RE: Freightlink Development & support contract (F-MIS9/159)



Hi Mark



It was good to catch up earlier in the week on a few ongoing matters. As discussed, I have now had the chance to prepare our proposal for the various matters discussed. I have itemised these as follows and provided a retainer proposal in addition, translating the itemised proposals into hours which you could use in the retainer if you wished to proceed with this.



Fixed Fees



 1. Marimosa  it is understood that this matter may not need to proceed any further. We agreed on a fixed fee of 1,250 + VAT for that work, which we would discount by the percentage corresponding to the retainer option which you chose should you proceed with that. Wed then translate that discounted figure into the corresponding number of hours at the discounted hourly rates under the retainer. Put simply, if you opted for a 4 hour retainer then we would discount by 15% to 1,062.50 + VAT and at my hourly rate of 233.75 + VAT under the retainer, this would equate to 4.5 hours.



 2. T&Cs Update  I anticipate this taking no more than 1 hour of time, reviewing whether there are any consequential amendments required in addition to inserting the required additional provisions regarding refunds and for certainty would be happy to fix it at this amount (and therefore 275 + VAT). Under the 4 hour retainer, this would benefit from a 15% discount.



 3. White Label Agreement  as mentioned, we created a form of WLA for CustomsLink to govern the relationship with the RHA and notwithstanding that this was a heavily negotiated document, we can utilise this as a starting point for creating a similar version for FLS. There will be a degree of work to decompile where we arrived with RHA and to ensure that it properly suits the needs of FLS (meanwhile reviewing the other form of WLA which has been being used to extract any useful provisions). I would estimate 6.5  7.5 hours but for certainty, would be happy to fix this at 7.5 hours (and therefore 2,062.50 + VAT). Under the 4 hour retainer, this would benefit from a 15% discount.



Retainer



As stated above, I have attached our retainer proposal. As youll see, we have set out (Partner-led) options varying from 4 up to 10 hours per month with discounts on our normal hourly rates increasing, the more hours you opt for. I would suggest that with a start date of 1 June, a 4 hour retainer may be of benefit at the outset if you did wish to take this up and I would be happy to retrospectively roll the Marimosa work and the above work into this in line with the hours stated. Id also wrap up our AS24 file and include any further work on that project within the retainer too from this point forwards. The attached should explain how the retainer works but as stated, you may roll over unused time and additional time would be charged at the discounted additional rate. Under retainers, we raise our first invoice after 3 months so as to average out the increased amount of initial work which we typically fine and ensure that you benefit from the most value.



I look forward to hearing from you.



Many thanks
John



John Pickervance

Partner, Head of Commercial

ETS - Spoke to Fiona whilst we dont have definitive data we have shadow data from a few DFDS, Stena and CLDN  Think we have also received from IF and ColorLine but Emese is on annual leave so we cant access the latest data. I have managed to dig out some old data up to Sept so we will have to go with that but have seen a PDF for Stena for Nov so will update that with the correct data.

Jay.

messages.subject: FW: Basic Administrations
messages.body:
FYI



From: John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Sent: 18 June 2025 09:28
To: Sales Team <Salesteam@freightlink.co.uk>; Logistics@freightlink.co.uk; Alan Aspinall <Alan@freightlink.co.uk>; Romey Hindle <Romey@freightlink.co.uk>
Cc: Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>; Stephanie Newsham <Stephanie@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: FW: Basic Administrations
Importance: High



All

This is the last time I will send this reminder, and will start acting 

Dont believe me Try Me!



The below email has been sent

05/02/2024

04/10/2024

18/02/2025

And now today

This is your last warning.





Team,

I want to emphasize the importance of basic administrative tasks and policy requirements to ensure you are consistently prepareddaily, weekly, and monthlywithout stress creeping in unexpectedly.

As you know, I strongly believe that preparation leads to performance. If were not prepared, were not performing. With that in mind, here are some key reminders to keep us on track.

This is also a reminder of what is required and the standards I expect, including what I will and will not tolerate.



 * F9 to be set to available or correct settings
 * Teams set to correct settings, and not overridden, if youre in a booked meeting  Outlook will sync with Teams
 * Desk Booking  as we grow the office gets busier, you need somewhere to sit. This also means dont book it if not being used.  After today you will be sent home if no desk booked and will not count as an office day.
 * WFH, and Charlie requirements  this is as per policy  3 Days office  if youre on holiday this does not count as one day of the office.  48 hours notice  I will no longer offer flexibility so dont ask
 * Cyberhoot  1 a month do in the first week were possible.
 * Dress codes.
 * Signing in and out of the building
 * Access Passes  find them and use them if you have lost speak to Katlin.



Daily Routine for working and Break

 * Starting  you arrive for work ready to start at your time, this means
    * Laptop on and working
    * If you want a brew, make before you start

 * Morning Cigarette Break 
    * between 1000 and 1030 
    * no more than two of you at a time

 * Lunch 1200-1400  (50 Mins for smokers)
    * 50% on lunch at any one time 

 * Afternoon Cigarette Break
    * Between 1430 and 1530
    * Only 2 at a time

 * Finishing time

Pack up at your finish time, not before.



Anyone wants to discuss, please dont hesitate to come to me.

messages.subject: RE: Alan Aspinall's Probation End is on Thursday 31 July
messages.body:
Already had the conversation.



I have told John that Alans probation needs to be extended, that may result in him making his own decision. He knows that discussion needs to take place this week. We have had several really robust discussions, and I have told him to serve notice on the vehicles but to ensure that any work we currently have can be covered, we will do that before the end of next week.



We discussed that the budget is the budget, and we need a strategy/recovery plan and this will be down to the existing Contract Logistics solution. If it means we need another planner then so be it but as you point out Alan is a very expensive asset and with the current performance in Reload we have lots of capacity internally.



He is pulling together a plan over the next few days and said we would sit down to have a high-level conversation before you return with a more in-depth decision making session on your return.



This for all the wrong reasons gives us the opportunity to look at amalgamating the 2 teams, neither in their current form have enough work so we need to act. Kev is on annual leave at the moment, that wont have helped the figures as we know he manufacturers a quieter period when he, Kate and Anna are on leave.



Some very difficult but very important swift decisions need to be taken, and he is more than aware of the situation. Our first conversation this morning was about his long term job security so he is in no doubt of the gravity of the situation. I did put his mind at rest but all other options for the wider team remain open!



Sorry for long reply!



Jay

messages.subject: Partnership Catch Up
messages.body:
Good Morning Al,



Long time no speak, I hope all is well with you and yours and business remains positive. I had taken a step back with our partners as Alex and John Gaskell our Head of Sales took over the day to day running of our commercial relationships. As you will no doubt be aware Alex is now no longer with the business so as on the 1st of October I have taken back the responsibility for all commercial activity for the foreseeable future. As we draw towards the end of 2025 I have been looking at the performance of our partnerships and I think its clear to say for a number of reasons we havent seen the traction we would have both expected. With this in mind would it be possible to get together to discuss how we can progress and gain further traction if that is actually possible.



I know we are entering into an extremely busy period but if we can get some time in the diary, either digitally or I can come down and visit to discuss how we move forward.



I look forward to hearing from you.



Regards



Jay.

M : + 44 (0) 7904 867758

To: Matthew Jackson <Matthew.Jackson@customs-link.com>; Mark Stephens <mark@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: RE: Future



Matt,



As you know Mark is on annual leave for the next few weeks but lets you and I have a catch up today. We did discuss at length the rationale behind our decision and also reaffirm our commitment to yourself to develop you within the business as a future leader. You are part of the SMT for a reason and as outlined we will,together, put a programme of development in place to ensure we and you arrive at that point.



Not sure if you are WFH today but if you are more than happy to do via Teams, let me now when is convenient.



Thanks



Jay.



From: Matthew Jackson <Matthew.Jackson@customs-link.com>
Sent: 16 October 2025 20:48
To: Mark Stephens <mark@freightlink.co.uk>; Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: Future



Hi both,

I wanted to take a moment to express my disappointment after learning about the upcoming appointment of the Operations Director, particularly after reviewing the job advertisement and realising how closely my experience and achievements align with the criteria for the role.



Having been with the business for almost four years, Ive worked hard and tirelessly to contribute to its growth and success.

A few key highlights include:

 Securing Princes work worth over 1 million and ensuring we succeed in its delivery.

 Being on the verge of closing a transport deal worth approximately 500,000

 Bringing in additional business valued at over 400,000

 Promoting a culture of ownership and proper customer service

 Delivering both AEO and ISO accreditations

 Ensuring accounts receive the support they need, being available 24/7 for customers

 Successfully delivering multiple projects, with the support and collaboration of the wider team



Whilst I know I may not always make the most popular of decisions I firmly believe I make the right decisions for the good of the business and these results reflect my ongoing commitment, commercial understanding, and ability to deliver strong operational and financial outcomes.



Thats why I must be honest, Im extremely disappointed to have been completely overlooked for consideration for this position. After everything Ive invested into this business, both personally and professionally, its disheartening to feel that my efforts and capabilities have not been recognised at this level.



I understand I made myself clear a few weeks back regarding my future however like John, Ive started to question where I fit within the companys future plans. While I fully respect your decision-making process, I cannot hide how disheartened I feel, nor my growing concern that I may no longer have a future here if my contributions are not being acknowledged.



I did want to catch you both today however I understand we were all busy however I am happy to talk over whenever.

Regards

Matt











Sent from Outlook for iOS

messages.subject: FW: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics
messages.body:
FYI  See highlighted



From: Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>
Sent: 29 July 2025 14:22
To: John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: RE: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics



John,



Thanks for the attached, great starting point for our discussions!



Please let me absolutely assure you we are committed to making the Contract Logistics Sector of our business work and will continue to invest both time and money to deliver the results outlined in a robust strategic plan. We are committed to supporting you and the Team, but it needs to be backed with a plan for success that both outlines the strategic platform and the projected ROI!



Jay.



From: John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Sent: 29 July 2025 10:17
To: Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics



Id asks the following questions, and this is without prejudice or emotion, purely business perspective.

Contract logistics overheads including myself have been mentioned a few time



1  Are we serious about a contract logistics department, Yes or No

 * We already have a department working on this, however its dressed up, GL, DHL, Mardix, why have another?
 * Departments compete for budget, leadership attention, or strategic priority, leading to tension and inefficiency.
 * Forwarding focuses on speed and cost-efficiency in transport, while logistics may prioritise inventory control and service levelsthese goals can clash
 * Clients may be confused about the companys core competency if messaging isnt clear and unified  IE Reload is Marketed actively, Contract logistics isnt.
 * Coordinating two distinct operational models requires strong leadership and clear governance to avoid silos and misalignment
 * Investment decisions (e.g., in tech or infrastructure) may favour one department over the other, causing friction
 * If both departments target similar clients, theres a risk of internal competition for the same business



2  If the answer is yes

 * How do we move forward
 * If I am to focus on this, I would need the bandwidth, autonomy and resource to do, I cant win business and not be able to deliver.
    * DHL prime example  I was on leave we got one quote, and only one quote then decided we wasnt doing it. Easy way forward, there simply wasnt any effort.

 * We need a team that will deliver.
 * I need to be removed from sales and SMT and any other duties.
 * We need to market and design tools similar to other forwarders  we dont do this whatsoever or at least on a competitive scale.
 * This will take time and if the above isnt in place it simply cannot be done.
 * Costs will be a major contributor, and without partners or resource we will simply fail. 
 * We need accreditations - why would someone trust us with freight if we are not accredited -
 * We keep the own vehicles going different supplier and trial for two more months.
 * We need partners and suppliers to sign up and have the workload to give us the arm we need whilst taking commercial risks and understanding commerciality, not job by job analysis. 



3 If the answer is no

 * We salvage what business we have and want to keep and transfer or give notice
 * We commence processing now the human aspects



This is unfortunately the reality of how logistics work, with very fine margins, high work levels and little reward, a lot of business is won on costs alone, and is a good fit for primary work already in place.

Hello Jason,



Thank you for our call earlier, its always a pleasure to catch up with you.



As mentioned, Im forwarding the email containing the minutes from the meeting during John and Alexandra's visit to Germany, along with an outstanding request.



Firstly, the number on our UTA Feery page (+49 6027 509 691) needs to be removed, as our colleague informed me that we no longer use this number and there is no replacement.

Hello Alexandra, John,



I hope you are doing great.

Following up on our meeting in August, I just wanted to ask if you and your IT colleagues had the chance to look at our API specifications Ive send on the 25th of August.



I also would like to ask if its possible to exclude the yellow marked phone number from the portal:





According to our customer care agents we dont use that phone number anymore and there is also no other phone number replacing that one.



Many thanks in advance.



Best regards,
Denisa



Von: LISMAN Denisa
Gesendet: Montag, 25. August 2025 15:41
An: Alexandra Dawe <alexandra@freightlink.co.uk>; John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Betreff: Follow Up on our meeting - 20th august



Dear Alexandra and John,



Thank you both for your visit to Kleinostheim. It was a pleasure to have you here, and I hope you had a safe journey home.



I would like to summarize the topics we discussed and outline the actions I am already working on:



Online Authorization - Phase 2:

 * Denisa, needs to provide the API Specification (Swagger) to Freightlink. Please find attached.
 * Freightlink should share the email addresses required for accessing our API console. There you will find the OAuth and the API Keys that can be generated.
 * Freightlink and UTA need to collaborate on use cases, with each party contributing their requirements.

Some points to consider already for the use cases:

 * Card authorization for immediate bookings,
 * Cancellation of bookings,
 * Card authorization for future crossings,
 * Transaction file generation.

(Our API Specification currently covers the first two scenarios: booking and crossing in the near future, as well as cancellations.)



Customs Link/Declarations:

 * There will be no registration fees for UTA customers accessing the customs link through UTA Ferry.
 * Declarations can be generated entirely (import, export) via the customs link, including future declarations such as SSGB, ENS, ELO, and ICS2.
 * Customs services will be available digitally for the following countries: UK, Germany, France, Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, and Portugal. No on-site offices are involved.
 * John, could you please provide more information on additional customs services available to UTA customers?
 * John and I still need to define the pricing and conditions.
 * Alexandra will send an email regarding the new ELO declarations and a How To document for sales.



Sales Training:

 * Training sessions will be organized by region after we finalize the customs link and declarations in UTA Ferry.



In the UTA Ferry Portal:

 * Replace box 3 with the Irish Ferries offer.
 * Offer on Dover-Calais at 199.99 via Irish Ferries.
 * The offer on Dover-Calais and Dover-Dunkerque, including a free meal on board for 203 via DFDS, remains unchanged.
 * UTA will reactivate the conditions for Dover-Calais.



Offers - John:

 * Irish Ferries
 * Price stages for the most popular routes
 * Customs services



Intermodal Information:

 * I will clarify whether we are permitted to offer this unaccompanied service to our customers.



UTA Tolls:

 * Support Freightlink with toll solutions for customers purchasing UTA toll boxes.



Monthly Reporting:

 * Freightlink will generate monthly reports to be shared with UTA.



Customer Mass Communication:

 * Special offers and better rates on select routes
 * Customs declarations through UTA Ferry
 * Mandatory declarations





Additionally, in case youve changed your address due to the new office, please send me your new address so we can update our systems and make a small amendment to the contract. I think it must be relevant also for when we receive invoices from Freightlink, that we update this information. Also, can the addendum be signed digitally via DocuSing? If so, can I add you, John, to sign it for Freightlink?



A follow-up meeting at the end of September to be scheduled.



I look forward to hearing from you.





Best regards,

Denisa





Denisa Lisman

Strategic Partner Management

Partner Manager Plus Services
T/+ 49 6027 509-192

M/ +49 160 5322601
www.uta.com
UNION TANK Eckstein GmbH & Co. KG
Heinrich-Eckstein-Str.1 - 63801Kleinostheim - Germany

messages.subject: FW: Data Subject Access Request (DSAR)  Personal Data Access
messages.body:
FYI



From: John. C Gaskell <j_gaskell@live.co.uk>
Sent: 15 December 2025 11:50
To: Stephanie Newsham <stephanie@freightlink.co.uk>
Cc: Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: Re: Data Subject Access Request (DSAR)  Personal Data Access



Good morning Steph,

Apologies for the delay in respondingI was awaiting further advice.

We will address each of the three matters separately rather than combining them into a single email.

Non-Compete Agreement

Regarding the non-compete agreement received, I am unable to sign it in its current form. The draft I briefly reviewed last Thursday included a defined time frame, whereas the version provided does not, and it also contains additional clauses that I did not propose or agree to.

As I am voluntarily entering into this agreement, I request the following amendments:

 * Removal of Sections 1, 2, and 3, as I did not agree to these terms. I remain aware of my existing contractual obligations, and this non-compete should serve only as an addition to my termination agreement.
 * Explicit statement that I am receiving no remuneration and that this agreement is voluntary.
 * A defined time limit, ending on 30 March 2026.
 * Clarification that I am signing to protect Freightlink and my daughter, Katie Gaskell, ensuring normal working practices can continue and avoiding any conflict of interest.
 * Competitor companies must be specifically listed and limited to that list. The current wording not limited to is too open to interpretation.
 * The agreement should become void upon Katies termination of employment, however that may occur during the stated period.
 * The scope must be restricted to competitors in the Ferry, Rail, and Tunnel sectors of the business. Extending it to all Freightlink operations leaves room for misinterpretation, particularly regarding freight forwarding or haulage companies.

I will forward a copy of the email I previously sent for reference.

DSAR

Once the above is resolved, I will advise on next steps. However, I reserve the right to exercise a DSAR in the future and will not sign any document that limits this right.

Legal Action

At present, legal action remains only a potential consideration. A DSAR may be required to progress matters further. I will not sign any document that prevents me from pursuing legal action in the future, and I reserve all rights in this regard.

I hope we can resolve these matters promptly.

Im aware we are losing time as my employment terminates in 15 Days.

Kind regards,









Sent from Outlook for Mac

From: Stephanie Newsham <stephanie@freightlink.co.uk>
Date: Friday, 12 December 2025 at 11:46
To: John. C Gaskell <j_gaskell@live.co.uk>
Cc: Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: RE: Data Subject Access Request (DSAR)  Personal Data Access

Good morning John,



Thank you for your time yesterday, it was great to see you too.

I can confirm that our meeting was held on a "without prejudice" basis. During the discussion, we shared documents confirming the business intention to promote you to Director in 2026, subject to the terms set out in the Development Plan provided to you on 25 September 2025.

Please find attached a copy of the Non-Compete Agreement, which will provide Freightlink with confirmation that is no conflict of interest. I will send it via Signable immediately.

To conclude the DSAR request, we will need written confirmation that you are withdrawing the request. You also confirmed you would provide written assurance that no further action will be taken against the business.

Kind regards

Steph





E: Stephanie@freightlink.co.uk

T:07540 751287

W: freightlink.co.uk

A: 12 Sceptre Court, Bamber Bridge, Preston, PR5 6AW, UK.



Steph Newsham

Head of HR

To:Stephanie Newsham <Stephanie@freightlink.co.uk>; Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject:Re: Data Subject Access Request (DSAR)  Personal Data Access



Morning Both

Thanks for your time yesterday was great to see you.



Before I confirm anything in writing, I spoke with my advisor yesterday evening (not Nuela) and I have a meeting later today with my ACAS case worker to go through what we discussed and my intentions, and to potentially shut down any case file.



Can you confirm yesterdays meeting was without prejudice or formal as my understanding this was an off the record conversation and discussion.

Would you also have a copy of the draft non-compete ?



I know we all took away some actions but just need to clarify.



Once I spoken with them this afternoon, (just for my own piece of mind) Ill come back to you and confirm what we discussed.



Speak soon

messages.subject: FW: Without prejudice -Subject to Contract
messages.body:
FYI



From: John. C Gaskell <j_gaskell@live.co.uk>
Sent: 24 December 2025 07:54
To: Stephanie Newsham <Stephanie@freightlink.co.uk>
Cc: Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: Re: Without prejudice -Subject to Contract



Morning Steph



Thank you for your email. For the purpose of clarity, I wish to place on record the following:

 At no point have I requested, nor raised concerns, regarding my post-termination clauses with Freightlink Solutions.

 This matter was initiated solely by an email from Mark, asking me to sign a post-termination clause to protect Freightlink.

 Upon my non-acceptance of this request, the company proceeded with what I consider emotional blackmail by targeting my daughter, restricting her employment opportunities, career development, and even threatening her future employment, by a non-existent conflict of interest .

 It was this action that prompted me, voluntarily, to offer an assurance limited to listed companies.



That said, I confirm that the amended agreement you have now provided is broadly acceptable, subject to some word changes for your review.



 * This must state it replaces Part 3 vi, by mutual agreement, for the 6-month term.

 * Freight links signature must also be on the document, to which they will sign first.



 * Whilst you cannot place Katies name in the contract, I would like to point out and place on record, I reserve the right to void this agreement, should Katie not be placed back onto normal duties immediately or her probation failed in a way I believe is another direct result of my choice to leave the business.



I trust this clarifies my position and look forward to resolving the matter constructively.



Kind regards, 

John Gaskell





Sent from Outlook for Mac

From: Stephanie Newsham <Stephanie@freightlink.co.uk>
Date: Tuesday, 23 December 2025 at 14:27
To: John. C Gaskell <j_gaskell@live.co.uk>
Cc: Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: RE: Without prejudice -Subject to Contract

Hi John,



Many thanks for your email. For the purpose of clarity, please can I confirm the companys position.



We sent you 3 emails on Friday, each intended to respond to various requests you have made over the last few weeks and try and move the position forward.



Post termination clauses



In response to you not being comfortable with the existing post termination clauses, we provided you with two options:- 

 1. We offered to produce a new document which would supersede your existing post termination clauses. The executive summary of that document was contained within my email sent on 19thDecember. You confirmed that you are unwilling to proceed with this as an option.
 2. On 17thDecember and again on 19thDecember, we sent over an agreement specifically listing the Freight Ferry competitors, which we would consider as direct competitors to FreightlinkSolutions Limited. This agreement effectively limits the scope of the Post Termination clause by excluding freight forwarders and hauliers, meaning the business would not take any further action should you chose to join a business providing these services. You confirmed that you are unwilling to proceed with this as an option.

We are committed to resolving this matter. We have now made some further amendments to the above document (number 2, attached) which we hope meets with your final satisfaction. Please could I ask you to review the amended document. This document formalises what you have confirmed in email dated 21stDecember. If we received this signed document, this would also provide the business with assurances and remove any potential conflict of interest. Upon receiving this signed document, we would be delighted to confirm to Katie she is able to move onto the weekend / evening shift cover with our Customer Services Team.

However as detailed in my email on Friday,if we are unable to reach an agreement, we do still expect you to comply with the current restrictions. Any failure to do so would amount to a breach of contract by you and your new employer and it would be open to Freightlink Solutions Limitedto pursue legal action against both of you.

 3. DSAR- We have received you email today. We will revert in due course.



Many thanks

Steph





E: Stephanie@freightlink.co.uk

T:07540 751287

W: freightlink.co.uk

A: 12 Sceptre Court, Bamber Bridge, Preston, PR5 6AW, UK.



Steph Newsham

Head of HR



Company registration number 4838153 | VAT no: GB 842 1813 44. Email Disclaimer| Privacy| Terms & Conditions

All business is transacted under the current edition of the BIFA Standard Trading Conditions.







From:John. C Gaskell <j_gaskell@live.co.uk>
Sent:21 December 2025 23:20
To:Stephanie Newsham <Stephanie@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject:Re: Without prejudice -Subject to Contract



HI Steph

Thank you for your email.



After reviewing the proposed terms, I need to make my position clear. I cannot sign this document. The entire process was intended to ensure that Katie is treated as an individual employee and to allow me, voluntarily, to give Freightlink assurances that there is no current conflict of interest.

To that end, I have already provided an email listing the companies supplied by Freightlink that I will not be joining as an employee or competitor. This was offered in good faith to demonstrate transparency and to avoid any suggestion of conflict.

There is no deal to be made here, nor any basis for an exchange of concessions. I am being asked to agree to additional and extended restrictions without any form of financial consideration or benefit. As it stands, the only beneficiaries of these proposed terms would be Freightlink, and I am not prepared to enter into an agreement on that basis.

I remain willing to provide reasonable assurances regarding conflict of interest, but I cannot agree to the terms outlined in your proposal.



Kind Regards





Sent from Outlook for Mac

From: Stephanie Newsham <Stephanie@freightlink.co.uk>
Date: Friday, 19 December 2025 at 17:01
To: John. C Gaskell <j_gaskell@live.co.uk>
Subject: Without prejudice -Subject to Contract

Dear John,



Thank you for speaking with Jay earlier today.



First of all, I wanted to clarify the current contractual position to avoid any uncertainty about your current restrictions. As you know, you have already signed an employment contract that includes a range of post-termination restrictions, including a 6 month non-compete clause. You have expressed concerns about referring to this in the new agreement. However, you are still bound by the terms set out in your Employment Contract whether the new agreement expressly refers to this or not. The only way the current restrictions can be varied is if we expressly agree to this under the newagreement. Therefore, if we are unable to reach an agreement, we do still expect you to comply with the current restrictions. Any failure to do so would amount to a breach of contract by you and your new employer and it would be open to Freightlink Solutions Limitedto pursue legal action against both of you. 



However, in light ofyour concerns and we are obviously very keen to try and resolve things amicably, we would like to propose a new agreement (as discussed with Jay on the phone earlier) which will replace the current restriction in your previous Employment Contract .



These are the key points which will form the new agreement:



 1. Outline your willingness to reduce the non-compete from six months to three months, in exchange for 12-month non-solicitation and non-deal obligations



 2. Confirm that these restrictions will link to your termination date and are separate from any other employment matters or other employees.



 3. Include obligations around data deletion, confidentiality, and disclosure of restrictions to any new employer.



 4. We would include general obligations from your current contract, such as the duty to disclose a copy of the new agreement restrictions to any new/prospective employer and not to hold yourself out as being connected to FreightlinkSolutions Ltd post-termination. We will also include an obligation for you to inform us in advance if you accept a job offer over the next 12 months.



 5. Address previous discussions regarding DSAR and grievance, and confirm that these could be withdrawn as part of the agreement. Whilst you are entitled to pursue both of these, during recent meetings you have suggested that if we can get the restrictions in a new agreement finalised, you would not pursue these. If thats the case, we would include a clause in the agreement to confirm you are withdrawing/not pursuing the DSAR and/or any grievance.



 6. Offer a standard reference as part of the agreement



If you would like to accept this offer, please let us know by 10.00am on Monday 22 December and a new written agreement will be circulated next week for your review which would need to be signed off before you finish your employment.



Kind regards
Steph









E: Stephanie@freightlink.co.uk

T:07540 751287

W: freightlink.co.uk

A: 12 Sceptre Court, Bamber Bridge, Preston, PR5 6AW, UK.



Steph Newsham

Head of HR



Company registration number 4838153 | VAT no: GB 842 1813 44. Email Disclaimer| Privacy| Terms & Conditions

All business is transacted under the current edition of the BIFA Standard Trading Conditions.

messages.subject: FW: Incoterm query
messages.body:
From: Ray Marshall <rmarshall@logistics.org.uk>
Sent: Thursday, February 22, 2024 3:57 PM
To: Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: Incoterm query



Good afternoon Jason,



I hope your keeping well, following on from our meeting we discussed getting a dummy account for us to look at and familiarise ourselves with so we can push the service when required to our members, and can talk it through to them to encourage them to use the new service, is it possible for this to be set up?.



On a secondary note, we have had a query from a member regarding Incoterms, as per below:



As just discussed on the phone, we have quoted our customers based on FCA Germany, where the customer is collecting the material from the manufacturer in Germany, who is responsible for the export clearance ?



The member is a UK based company, and their customer is also UK based, the material is manufactured in Germany, the member quoted the customer FCA Germany, and they are arranging collection.



It is our understanding that unless otherwise agreed upon, the seller is only responsible for loading the goods if the sellers place of business is the named place of delivery.



Can you shed any light or have a person within your team that would know this, I am happy to suggest the member contact yourselves after we have dealt with this query for their future requirements.



Also, I am not sure a UK based company can actually perform export declarations on the German customs portal, or are they allowed.



Unfortunately, whenever customs or exporting comes in as a question we do refer members to a specialist customs agent and try not to get involved.



Any help you can give will be greatly received.



Kind Regards



Ray









Ray Marshall
Manager - Compliance Information
Logistics UK
Phone: 01926 884037

www.logistics.org.uk

messages.subject: FW: Freightlink Development & support contract (F-MIS9/159)
messages.body:
BR

Mark Stephens

Director



From: John Pickervance <John.Pickervance@forbessolicitors.co.uk>
Date: Friday, 26 May 2023 at 09:45
To: Mark Stephens <mark@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: RE: Freightlink Development & support contract (F-MIS9/159)

Hi Mark



It was good to catch up earlier in the week on a few ongoing matters. As discussed, I have now had the chance to prepare our proposal for the various matters discussed. I have itemised these as follows and provided a retainer proposal in addition, translating the itemised proposals into hours which you could use in the retainer if you wished to proceed with this.



Fixed Fees



 1. Marimosa  it is understood that this matter may not need to proceed any further. We agreed on a fixed fee of 1,250 + VAT for that work, which we would discount by the percentage corresponding to the retainer option which you chose should you proceed with that. Wed then translate that discounted figure into the corresponding number of hours at the discounted hourly rates under the retainer. Put simply, if you opted for a 4 hour retainer then we would discount by 15% to 1,062.50 + VAT and at my hourly rate of 233.75 + VAT under the retainer, this would equate to 4.5 hours.



 2. T&Cs Update  I anticipate this taking no more than 1 hour of time, reviewing whether there are any consequential amendments required in addition to inserting the required additional provisions regarding refunds and for certainty would be happy to fix it at this amount (and therefore 275 + VAT). Under the 4 hour retainer, this would benefit from a 15% discount.



 3. White Label Agreement  as mentioned, we created a form of WLA for CustomsLink to govern the relationship with the RHA and notwithstanding that this was a heavily negotiated document, we can utilise this as a starting point for creating a similar version for FLS. There will be a degree of work to decompile where we arrived with RHA and to ensure that it properly suits the needs of FLS (meanwhile reviewing the other form of WLA which has been being used to extract any useful provisions). I would estimate 6.5  7.5 hours but for certainty, would be happy to fix this at 7.5 hours (and therefore 2,062.50 + VAT). Under the 4 hour retainer, this would benefit from a 15% discount.



Retainer



As stated above, I have attached our retainer proposal. As youll see, we have set out (Partner-led) options varying from 4 up to 10 hours per month with discounts on our normal hourly rates increasing, the more hours you opt for. I would suggest that with a start date of 1 June, a 4 hour retainer may be of benefit at the outset if you did wish to take this up and I would be happy to retrospectively roll the Marimosa work and the above work into this in line with the hours stated. Id also wrap up our AS24 file and include any further work on that project within the retainer too from this point forwards. The attached should explain how the retainer works but as stated, you may roll over unused time and additional time would be charged at the discounted additional rate. Under retainers, we raise our first invoice after 3 months so as to average out the increased amount of initial work which we typically fine and ensure that you benefit from the most value.



I look forward to hearing from you.



Many thanks
John



John Pickervance

Partner, Head of Commercial

T: DD 0333 207 1134 M 07976 257777

E: john.pickervance@forbessolicitors.co.uk

Web: www.forbessolicitors.co.uk

Twitter: @forbessolicitor

Sent: 09 May 2023 13:20
To: 'Mark Stephens' <mark@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: RE: Freightlink Development & support contract (F-MIS9/159)



Hi Mark



Noted and understood. I have any time Monday or Tuesday AM next week if either of those work for you? Ill send round a Teams for whenever is convenient for you on those days.



Thanks

John



John Pickervance

Partner, Head of Commercial

T: DD 0333 207 1134 M 07976 257777

E: john.pickervance@forbessolicitors.co.uk

Web: www.forbessolicitors.co.uk

messages.subject: Re: System improvements / ideas
messages.body:
Hi Aneta,



Can I just manage expectations and underline some parts from my original email.



So  as you know we have hundreds of development request in the pipeline. Each one MUST stack up against each other and deliver a VALUE and we compare that against all the developments within the business.



You as HOT of that team, will write the business case for these  eg What is saving or what is the commercial opportunity.



Example - I have a live example of a request I have rejected  Someone within your team wanted an update doing on Trade vehicles so that when they were being sold, the vehicle was marked as loaded. I have done a quick calculation, and that development would assist us in less than .5% of all bookings. The actual dev would take 3-4 days. We dont have 3-4 days for a dev that will impact 1 booking in 200  we have to manage that manually somehow. The developments we MUST focus on are the ones to clear your team blockers, and thats what I will focus on.



This is YOUR team, managing YOUR pipeline in terms of priority. I am here to help that process.



I dont want this appear to be negative, you team need to understand we do anything and everything to help.but you guys must help yourselves in terms of organising the priority. So from the list below  what are your TOP 3 in terms of delivering the highest value, and why ?



Can you chase up all the Team leaders for their recommendations and lets see and come up multiple times 



BR

Mark Stephens

Director

messages.subject: FW: Lost Bookings last week
messages.body:
Hi Jay,



John asked me was there a way to report on these lost bookings  short answer no, not without dev  with dev off top of my head is, a serios of new Cancelled  X reason



EG



Cancelled  operator no space

Cancelled  operator no response

Cancelled  booked another route

Etc etc etc



When speaking to John  in summary he is investigating standby bookings what he has discovered is there is a high number of bookings are cancelled because we were unable to confirm the booking reference from the ferry operator. If you look at the attached below there are 20 examples and when I did a quick analysis there are 13 cancelled bookings be because we were inefficient in obtaining a booking confirmation - that translates to 65%.



If we then use that statistic against all cancelled bookings it's a big number we are dealing with.



I know that CS are working very hard at standbys but there actually is a financial argument to having a dedicated resource on this. Aneta is providing more data to John tomorrow he will analyse this further. I am fully aware that the CS team are manning up and training, but as an idea  could Yanni as an example to do nothing but chase standby bookings to see what improvements could be made ?



I know you are AL next week  just trying to head this off.





BR

Director

messages.subject: Commercial role
messages.body:
Gents,



As times ticks on, I believe the role of commercial manager is becoming ever more critical to our success in 2024+. As we go through the process and CVs, the more I consider this conundrum. It becomes more and more apparent to me that if we appoint the wrong person, Alex, closely followed by Jay, end up spending an increasing amount of time doing what you have both done for months which is backfilling Monika rolewhilst under increasing pressure. The role is that critical, failure means we really do apply pressure to budget success.



If we do make a good appointment, there is the fact that we will lose 3+ months as X learns the ropes. Equally Alex, one of your strong feelings was always to remain in touch with sales. This position weakens that link, and in fact, the new owner of that team, we as directors become increasingly more reliant on them to deliver the results for 2024. Its a tough ask for someone with industry knowledge let alone a newbie !



I want to put a spotlight on the elephant. Jays knowledge of CUSTOMS is very low (I am sure you will not mind me pointing this out). However, Jay continues to add value to support Matt and the team to deliver the strategy. The no 1 problem we have in CL is SALES. Matts engagement here is low to medium. To add fuel to this fire, we have witnessed Jacob ratcheting the rhetoric with CL strategy. I must assume this is not just a Jacob thought. Equally we all agree CL holds the BIGGEST opportunity of the 3 pillars. With this, we need to find a way to put our best foot forward to increase our chances of success.



So how do we DE-RISK the sales, and IMPROVE % OF SUCCESS & PERFORMANCE ??? Lets not take anything from the table, and I accept this is not an exact round peg in a round hole, but I think this rounds a square peg.it is not a finished product !



See Organogram PAGE 2

Attached Headlines:-



 a. Help Jay with a heavy weight  Jen takes over managing CS and supports that unit. I have called here office manager so she can carry on with some of the tasks she manages now.
 b. Back fill Jens role with a relatively lower salaried project manager  30k -  35K  see (e)
 c. Decrease Jays direct management reports to focus. In Q1, Kev report to John (think that was the plan  so nothing new then)
 d. Jay takes over Freightlink / CustomsLink sales inc partners  I think I have said this before, put the best person in the best role. He has done this job prior to a very high standard, so this massively de-risks the business position. Yes the learning curve remains with CL sales, BUT Jay is a accomplished sales professional.
 e. LUMPY BIT 1)Alex takes back strategic responsibility of CustomsLink..OR2)we have to find the unicorn to drive that business forward. If (2) delivers better performance, at this stage we cancel (b) above, Tom will pick this up, and the digital has to manage. I think this is viable NOW, but when I am removed, it probably needs that skill.
 f. I dont have a finalised vision of e2 (new role to drive CL forward.
 g. E2  the new role to drive CL forward, I am not 100% convinced John Lucy could deliver this. He is good guy, I am not convinced John Lucy is that and I think he is C 70K  his old job was  90k)
 h. WILD CARD  is there a better solution WITH John within the business ? I have run out of time to think this one through  but smells like 70K ????



I know in the past Alex you have been uneasy with structure changes. I will be honest I dont, If a team is not working as well as it could, change it in my view. I feel Alex you worry about the Stena Line POV. My thoughts are IF any of the above sticks, we say nothing at the board meeting next week. When we visit in March, we tell them what we did to IMPROVE performance. That shows good leadership. 



For our internal team, these are all comfortable changes with no sudden jolts that would concern me when speaking to the teams.



Gents 100% I am not being mischievous here. I want what is best for the business, and I know my opinions are challenging for your both. I am sorry for that, but in equal measure I need to be true to my feelings and thoughts.



I really hope this helps in some way.



Best regards

Mark Stephens



Mark Stephens

Director

Freightlink Solutions

From: Jennifer Sharpe <Jennifer.Sharpe@customs-link.com>
Date: Monday, 13 January 2025 at 15:41
To: Frank <Frank@freightlink.co.uk>, Alex McDonald <Alex@freightlink.co.uk>, Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>, Catherine Taylor <Catherine@freightlink.co.uk>, Mark Stephens <mark@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: Ops SMM > Nov/Dec 24

Hi all



Its been an incredibly intense 8 weeks, with pressure continuing for the next 4 weeks until SSGB is live and working for both FL & CL.



State of Play/Major items:



The N. Sea ENS and Drupal update is complete with some small fixes/update. All critical and high priority items are completed. Now dealing with medium items (mostly links / some images not pulling through.

NEXT SSGB for the business 

CL  final snagging a amends eg EU EORI now acceptable  only found this out Wed 08th Jan.

FL  deployment completed Thu 09th Jan.

High level of intensity to get this completed for deadlines. This will need a lot of my focus and Dan K we will get this over the line.



Update on SSGB > we are working through the issues and doing our best to get this over the line for w/c 20th Jan.



MBO updates > none, this will be picked back up in Feb.



Delivered in the past 8 weeks

Freightlink:

(Nov) N. Sea ENS updates > we had a few issues, these should all be resolved. We might discover a few glitches as customers use them. NOTE P&O & DFDS have not declared the full data set required. This will require last minuite changes to ensure this syncs.

Stena EDI directly to portal

DFDS/P&O entered manually in booking portals (Dev guys working on a Google Chrome plug in solution so it will auto-populate data in web browser, less manual clicks for CS)

(Dec) Drupal 10 for all Partners and FL Web (DKV/UTA/Stena Cash/LUK

(Dec) Appv1/Troi includes Servitir

(Nov) AWS for FL Pay

(Dec) FL Payment Reminders automated from F2

(Dec) FL web customs blue box descriptions > exact customs info requirements for routes (use to be a generic statement)

(Dec) FL Virtual EDI  acts like an EDI by automatically sending an email to the operator and reading the response back by auto-populating F2. Live but not switched on yet, we do in Feb.

(Dec) FL F2 changes for finance team

(Dec) Other small updates & bug fixes to F2 > updates to history log/Auto select ENS & PP for bookings/Reload postcode update.

(Jan) C2A website switched off  there was a lot of noise here  this had been communicated to sales months in advance. Now all customers directed to FL Web > Work of white label will commence Mon 13th Jan. Target - work will be completed for testing end of Feb.



I have attached the email that includes a high-level view of the fixes and outstanding issues > I have sent daily updates to FL and been in constant contact with CS and dev team.

Still outstanding includes:

VAT collection for incorrect payments ongoing with accounts/CS (dev fix complete)

Servitir/Appv1 > updates on routes such as cancelled/disrupted need to display correct

Servitir API bookings sometimes being sent incorrect



CustomsLink:

(Dec) SSGB on CL platform > lots of small changes (Consignee & Consignor updates/text changes/email templates updates/999 items allowed/error fixes  this was a last min requirement)

(Dec) Stena SSGB API (will review in January before 31st Jan requirement)

(Dec) Tracking customer account creation

(Dec) 2020 bug fixes & updates > fixed searches/space saving on screen/page count/CSV exports/search with MRN)

(Dec) VAT API updates

(Dec) FL Pay on AWS

(Dec) Updates for port charges. MVP agreed than Dan B wanted to add more requirements. Agreed NOT to do these to execute MVP.





Next Projects/Issues to get resolved  Q1

See attached excel highlighting confirmed pipeline and new dev requests.



Freightlink next 12 weeks (Large projects):

SSGB on booking journey (Classic & Digital)

messages.subject: FW: Sales source etc
messages.body:
BR

Mark Stephens

Director



From: Mark Stephens <mark@freightlink.co.uk>
Date: Tuesday, 18 February 2025 at 22:41
To: Alex McDonald <Alex@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: Sales source etc

Hi Alex,



As discussed in SMM attached is a breakdown of the Sales sources and other descriptions we use. As I indicated, its a lot more complex than a simple sales source. The different data capture points have grown over many years to fulfil many different requirements. I have tried to capture all of these and provide a breakdown.



The single closest thing we have to a single source of truth is Sales source. This is driven from customer sign up in web / app > F2F2 > Account open > Sales input into a new tab in F2F2 manually. If the sales guys used this properly, we genuinely have a better picture. There are some fail safes in here to try and stop sales manipulating the inbound sales and saying they converted it. I found generally they took an inbound call or rang an existing web/app account and then claimed a conversion,. Yes its sales.its farming not hunting. Appreciate we need both. I have been here many times with sales. When we scratch the surface, we discover some bending of the truths.



I always encouraged sales to generated new sales on an annual basis to deliver +20% costs. The year prior sales then became a house account. Hence the reason converted by X 2024 / 2025 etc so we could track individual performance in that year. 



Not complaining, we have done this exercise last year when we tried to get sales to follow a process. The original doc Fiona produced is also attached.



Again, not complaining, this took me 1h 45m today to interrogate and get into the details and test the data. I hope this helps you get a better understanding. Ordinarily I know you would go to Fiona on this, but I said I would deliver.



My POV, I think we make do with what we have and use it as intended and tighten up the process, or we bend the existing structures for new uses as you and John see fit. NB doing the second will muddy historical reporting. Its not impossible, but please be-aware of the limitations this path would deliver. The data capture is complex and ties into many threads. As you know later this year, we will be looking to integrate a CRM, I would suggest thats the time to decide and change things.



However this might be a bit disappointing in terms of change, I hope thats all helpful.



Happy to go through when we both have time.



Best regards

Mark Stephens



Mark Stephens

Director

Freightlink Solutions

mark@freightlink.co.uk



+44 (0) 7793 204 440



+44 (0) 1772 282 592



Quarry Bank, Chorley Road, Preston, PR5 4JN, UK

freightlink.co.uk

As discussed:-



HOT meetings



 1. Fiona results update
 2. Alex has departed  its time to look forward  new structure expand.

Jay focus on commercial activities with John / MS operational focus.

Long term proposal Jay and I working with Anders to develop that. May bring in talent where to support gaps either at a senior level or where needed to allow you to grow / develop and help us grow the business as PACE

 3. HOT meetings  Commencing immediately  twice monthly
 4. How can we improve this meeting ? 1 idea from each person
 5. Your are our LEADERS  a lot of the time you will be working IN the business  making it work and driving excellence for our customers. For next standup, we want you to think about 2 things you can do that work ON the business  eg how we GROW / IMPROVE PERFORMANCE

Customer service Freightlink

Customer service Customslink

More efficient delivery in software

Improve sales

Improve reload performance / Contract logistics

Improve our Customs compliance process & help customers

Improve efficiencies in accounts

messages.subject: Re: SMM 14/15th May
messages.body:
Hi Frank,



We have changed the strategic element at the end of the day. Catherine, I know you are under MEGA pressure, we will supply mins for the meeting if thats OK. Will give you a couple of hours back.



1. OPENING BRIEFING: 12:30  12:40

v General Information/ Business status; Group/SL news

v Key objectives for today/ tomorrow; any additional items for the agenda?



2. Minutes: 12:40  13:30

v Minutes 17th April. ALL: Kindly update minutes by 9th May.



3. Finance & Performance Review: 13:30  14:30 Catherine / Fiona

v 13:30  14:00 Catherine - Finance report presentation  April; May forward view. Note: Aged debt review at future SMM meetings? Pending  see 20.11.24.02.

v 14:00  14:30 Fiona Statistical analytics  presentation of data stats. (results & trends vs. budget & LY. Variances etc.).

v Included in above Supplier & customer performance  Trading results, Market Share Competitor Activities/ Market Watch.



Break 15 mins

4. HR: 14:45  15:15 Steph / Catherine

v Organisation updates and monthly HR report; MBOs



5. Strategic Forum: 15:15  17:00  Frank / Mark / Jay 15-1600hrs

 * Focus on growth Hercules
 * John Gaskell 1600hrs  1700hrs commercial strategic pathway



AOB









BR

Mark Stephens

Director



From: Frank <Frank@freightlink.co.uk>
Date: Tuesday, 6 May 2025 at 10:16
To: Mark Stephens <mark@freightlink.co.uk>, Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>, Catherine Taylor <Catherine@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: SMM 14/15th May

Good morning,



Please find attached proposed AGENDA for the SMM Meeting last week. If you would like to include additional items or change anything please let me know.



In the meantime, I also attach a copy of the minutes from the meeting last month. Obviously with the distractions prevailing at the time of the previous meeting there is a need to update the minutes as much as possible before we meet up next week. Ive highlighted all OPEN ITEMS previously allocated to Alex in yellow  we need to decide what will happen to these going forward.



As usual the HoT reports should be with me this week so that I can submit my report.



All the best and many thanks,



Frank

messages.subject: Reload 2026 & personal terms - Confidential
messages.body:
Hi Kevin,
Thank you again for your time yesterday.
As discussed, due to a combination of factors, our volumes and gross profit will fall short of the 2025 budget. This unfortunately means were not in a position to increase any packages or costs at this time. The business is reliant on achieving its budget targets.
We shared our 2026 budget plans with you, which I trust you agree are realistic and take into account the challenges your team has faced this year. The budget reflects the current run rate with a 10% uplift, and youll also benefit from any retained work from Contract Logistics following Johns departure.
Your continued commitment and support in delivering this plan is essential. You've made it clear that you do not wish to proceed with hiring a new BDM at this stage, and we respect that decision. You know your clients and market better than anyone, and we support your approach. However, its vital that we see a clear recovery plan that drives growth.
I was encouraged to hear that you and your team will take ownership of generating new sales. As you know, weve struggled to deliver on this front in recent years, and we must avoid repeating that pattern in 2026.
To support this, we need to agree on a set of key KPIs that you and the team are fully aligned with. If we fall short of these KPIs, we must be prepared to adjust our strategy. We cannot afford to persist with a plan that isnt delivering results. If something isnt working, we need to fix itquickly and decisively.
These KPIs will primarily focus on new business development and sales growth. Lets work together to ensure we have a robust framework in place to track and drive performance.
In recognition of your support and the extra hard work you will undertake in 2026, we will adjust your package as follows:-


 * Current salary  47,550.00 plus bonus
 * Monthly bonus 2025 (amended immediately) on target  300 per month (as discussed Jay will agree these with you)
 * 01st Jan 2026  51,500.00 (10.5% /  3950)



For 2026, we will also amend your monthly targets as follows. This provides you with an easier initial target to hit (on budget), plus the ability to earn considerably more bonus as your overachieve.



Kevin

Month GP

Quarter GP

Annual GP

Annualised bonus if all achieved

Budget

400

This is a substantial step forward and underlines our support of you. This must also be seen as a stepped change in not just your effort but your continued growth in professionalism. Jay, Steph and myself are committed to supporting you to not only achieve the above, but also your personal growth goals.


Before we put this increase formally in writing from the business, I would like you to confirm we have your full commitment going forward.


Best Regards
Mark Stephens


E: mark@freightlink.co.uk
T: + 44 (0) 779 320 4440

MARK STEPHENS

Director

I have done some digging here. I don't think we are bound to supplying some off the documents requested:- IN RED


I DSAR request is personal data - obv this included emails etc TO him where we have asked him to act upon something.



 My complete employee file.

 Performance: All records relating to my performance. This includes performance reviews, all one-to-one meeting records (121s), including dates of submission, performance improvement plans, disciplinary records, and any other documentation relating to my work performance.

 Support and Guidance: All documents that have been used to guide or support my work and development. This includes training materials, policy documents, emails providing guidance and procedural explanations/guidelines, and any other relevant materials.

 All communications, documentation, and correspondence: This includes all emails, text messages, instant messages, and any other form of electronic or written communication concerning me and my work whether they reference me directly or indirectly.



In accordance with GDPR, I request:



 That this information is provided in a clear and easily understandable format within the statutory timeframe.

 Details of any recipients or categories of recipients to whom my data has been disclosed.

 Information on the purposes for which my data is being processed.

 The envisaged retention period for my data, or the criteria used to determine that period.



Please confirm receipt of this request and kindly let me know at the earliest opportunity if you require any further details to identify the data.



Thank you for your cooperation.



Sincerely, 

John Gaskell

Betreff: Follow Up on our meeting - 20th august



Dear Alexandra and John,



Thank you both for your visit to Kleinostheim. It was a pleasure to have you here, and I hope you had a safe journey home.



I would like to summarize the topics we discussed and outline the actions I am already working on:



Online Authorization - Phase 2:

 * Denisa, needs to provide the API Specification (Swagger) to Freightlink. Please find attached.
 * Freightlink should share the email addresses required for accessing our API console. There you will find the OAuth and the API Keys that can be generated.
 * Freightlink and UTA need to collaborate on use cases, with each party contributing their requirements.

Some points to consider already for the use cases:

 * Card authorization for immediate bookings,
 * Cancellation of bookings,
 * Card authorization for future crossings,
 * Transaction file generation.

(Our API Specification currently covers the first two scenarios: booking and crossing in the near future, as well as cancellations.)



Customs Link/Declarations:

 * There will be no registration fees for UTA customers accessing the customs link through UTA Ferry.
 * Declarations can be generated entirely (import, export) via the customs link, including future declarations such as SSGB, ENS, ELO, and ICS2.
 * Customs services will be available digitally for the following countries: UK, Germany, France, Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, and Portugal. No on-site offices are involved.
 * John, could you please provide more information on additional customs services available to UTA customers?
 * John and I still need to define the pricing and conditions.
 * Alexandra will send an email regarding the new ELO declarations and a How To document for sales.



Sales Training:

 * Training sessions will be organized by region after we finalize the customs link and declarations in UTA Ferry.



In the UTA Ferry Portal:

 * Replace box 3 with the Irish Ferries offer.
 * Offer on Dover-Calais at 199.99 via Irish Ferries.
 * The offer on Dover-Calais and Dover-Dunkerque, including a free meal on board for 203 via DFDS, remains unchanged.
 * UTA will reactivate the conditions for Dover-Calais.



Offers - John:

 * Irish Ferries
 * Price stages for the most popular routes
 * Customs services



Intermodal Information:

 * I will clarify whether we are permitted to offer this unaccompanied service to our customers.



UTA Tolls:

 * Support Freightlink with toll solutions for customers purchasing UTA toll boxes.



Monthly Reporting:

 * Freightlink will generate monthly reports to be shared with UTA.



Customer Mass Communication:

 * Special offers and better rates on select routes
 * Customs declarations through UTA Ferry
 * Mandatory declarations





Additionally, in case youve changed your address due to the new office, please send me your new address so we can update our systems and make a small amendment to the contract. I think it must be relevant also for when we receive invoices from Freightlink, that we update this information. Also, can the addendum be signed digitally via DocuSing? If so, can I add you, John, to sign it for Freightlink?



A follow-up meeting at the end of September to be scheduled.



I look forward to hearing from you.





Best regards,

Denisa

messages.subject: DSAR DRAFT
messages.body:
Dear John
We are writing to confirm that the timeframe for responding to your Data Subject Access Request (DSAR) has been extended by two months, in accordance with Article 12(3) of the UK GDPR, which permits an extension where requests are complex or numerous.
This extension is necessary for several reasons:
 1. Change in Request Status: During our meeting on [date], you indicated that you intended to withdraw your DSAR. It was only on [date] that you confirmed your decision to proceed, which has impacted our ability to progress within the original timeframe.
 2. Scope of the Request: Your DSAR is broad and non-specific, resulting in an exceptionally large volume of data being identified. The proportion of this data that contains personal information is relatively small compared to standard business communications you were already privy to. See below specific information
 3. Redaction Requirements: A significant portion of the data includes confidential customer and supplier information, as well as details relating to other team members. This requires extensive redaction to protect third-party rights and confidentiality, which is a time-intensive process.
 4. Resource Constraints: The Christmas period has reduced the availability of both internal resources and those of our third-party providers, further contributing to the complexity of fulfilling your request promptly.

Please be assured that we have maintained a detailed record of all actions taken to obtain relevant data, including MS Exchange and MS Teams content from Evolve, and have sought legal advice to ensure compliance throughout this process.
We remain committed to completing your request as soon as possible and will keep you updated on progress.
We are able to provide the following information:-
 1. Extract board papers Sept 25
 2. Extract board papers Nov 25
 3. Email requesting you to join SMT
 4. Email following acceptance to join the SMT
 5. Email from you confirming you would like to be withdrawn from sales and SMT
 6. 121 copies / personnel files
 7. Director career development plan

We are committed to delivering the DSAR request. If you are able to reduce the scope of the DSAR this will facilitate an improved timeline example between XXX - YYY dates, specific people. This would narrow the scope of your request to expedite the process.


The first search criteria:-


John Gaskell or JG or John@freightlink.co.uk
AND Message Kind contains any IM (Instant message) and Message Kind contains any of Microsoft Teams. (These help to export any information related to Teams); Date anything after 1st January 2023
OR
Participant contains any of john@freightlink.co.uk
Recipients contains any of john@freightlink.co.uk
Sender contains any of john@freightlink.co.ukwith all item's containing "John Gaskell"


Results - 200GB of data. Based upon most of the email / teams correspondence being text, this is over 100 million pages of emails. Within this data, the vast majority of emails / team which do not contain personal data, only business emails.


John@freightlink.co.uk
AND Message Kind contains any IM (Instant message) and Message Kind contains any of Microsoft Teams. (These help to export any information related to Teams); Date anything after 1st January 2023
OR
Recipients contains any of john@freightlink.co.uk
Sender contains any of john@freightlink.co.uk


Results - 20GB of data. Based upon most of the email / team's correspondence being text, this is over 10 million pages of emails. Again, within this data, the vast majority of emails / team which do not contain personal data, only business emails.






Best Regards
Mark Stephens


E: mark@freightlink.co.uk
T: + 44 (0) 779 320 4440
W: www.freightlink.co.uk

Director

Dear John

Re: Garden Leave and Ongoing Contractual Obligations

I am writing to formally confirm our conversation on Monday 20th October 2025.Under your notice period, your final date of employment with our organisation would have been 30th December 2025. However, instead of you working out your notice period, we have decided to place you ongarden leavefrom 20th October 2025 in accordance with clause 21 of your Employment Contract.



This means that you will continue to receive full pay and benefits (with the exception of benefits that are given to allow you to do your job, such as a work mobile phone or car allowance) in the normal way. You remain bound by all the obligations and restrictions set out in your Employment Contract, save the duty to attend work. You will not be allowed to come to work and must stay away from the workplace during thegarden leaveperiod. During thegarden leaveperiod, you are not permitted to take up other employment and are required to remain available to be contacted by our organisation and to do any work requested by our organisation.



I would like to remind you that you are still bound by the obligations and restrictions set out in clauses below of your Employment Contract. For the avoidance of doubt, I set out below the clauses that apply:



 * Part 1, Clause 16: Confidential Information: You are strictly prohibited from disclosing, using, or retaining any confidential information acquired during the course of your employment. This obligation survives termination and is enforceable under both contractual and common law principles.
 * Part 1, Clause 21: Garden Leave:During any period of Garden Leave, you will remain an employee of the Company and bound by the terms of your contract.You must remain available to assist with any reasonable requests from the company, including attending meetings or providing information. All accrued unused holiday entitlement will be taken during Garden Leave. You must not contact or deal with the named parties in vii, or take alternative employment during Garden Leave without explicit consent from us.
 * Part 1, Clause 10 and Part 3: Post Termination Restrictions: Upon termination of your employment, you will be subject to the restrictive covenants set out in your contract, including but not limited to:
   * Non-compete obligations prohibiting engagement in any business that competes with Freightlink Solutions Limited.
   * Non-solicitation and non-dealing clauses relating to clients, customers, suppliers, and employees of the Company.
 * Conduct: You are expected to maintain professional conduct and refrain from any activity that may cause reputational, operational, or commercial harm to Freightlink Solutions Limited.

Any breach of these obligations will be treated as a serious matter. Freightlink Solutions Limited reserves the right to pursue all available legal remedies, including injunctive relief, damages, and costs, without further notice.

This letter is issued without prejudice to any rights or remedies the Company may have under contract or law.

Should you have any questions regarding your obligations during garden leave, please XXXX.

Yours sincerely,
