messages.subject: Re: SMM 14/15th May
messages.body:
Hi Frank,



We have changed the strategic element at the end of the day. Catherine, I know you are under MEGA pressure, we will supply mins for the meeting if thats OK. Will give you a couple of hours back.



1. OPENING BRIEFING: 12:30  12:40

v General Information/ Business status; Group/SL news

v Key objectives for today/ tomorrow; any additional items for the agenda?



2. Minutes: 12:40  13:30

v Minutes 17th April. ALL: Kindly update minutes by 9th May.



3. Finance & Performance Review: 13:30  14:30 Catherine / Fiona

v 13:30  14:00 Catherine - Finance report presentation  April; May forward view. Note: Aged debt review at future SMM meetings? Pending  see 20.11.24.02.

v 14:00  14:30 Fiona Statistical analytics  presentation of data stats. (results & trends vs. budget & LY. Variances etc.).

v Included in above Supplier & customer performance  Trading results, Market Share Competitor Activities/ Market Watch.



Break 15 mins

4. HR: 14:45  15:15 Steph / Catherine

v Organisation updates and monthly HR report; MBOs



5. Strategic Forum: 15:15  17:00  Frank / Mark / Jay 15-1600hrs

 * Focus on growth Hercules
 * John Gaskell 1600hrs  1700hrs commercial strategic pathway



AOB









BR

Mark Stephens

Director

Subject: SMM 14/15th May

Good morning,



Please find attached proposed AGENDA for the SMM Meeting last week. If you would like to include additional items or change anything please let me know.



In the meantime, I also attach a copy of the minutes from the meeting last month. Obviously with the distractions prevailing at the time of the previous meeting there is a need to update the minutes as much as possible before we meet up next week. Ive highlighted all OPEN ITEMS previously allocated to Alex in yellow  we need to decide what will happen to these going forward.



As usual the HoT reports should be with me this week so that I can submit my report.



All the best and many thanks,



Frank

Subject: KYC review required for (CUSTOMSLINK LIMITED); Please respond by (22/08/2025) Case Reference (1-2506308185); Client Reference (5471283563); Initial Requirement







KYC Refresh_ 5471283563/11/08/2025


ITS TIME FOR CUSTOMSLINK LIMITEDS KYC REVIEW PLEASE RESPOND BY 22/08/2025

Hello Mark/Catherine,

My name is Rajesh Karri and Im a KYC Analyst at Barclays. Im working with your relationship director, Steve Butler, to complete the Know Your Customer (KYC) review for CUSTOMSLINK LIMITED.

Barclays is required to regularly update our client records by identifying the individuals who control and own the businesses that bank with us. To meet our regulatory and internal requirements and ensure were able to continue our banking relationship with you, its important we work together to complete this review as soon as possible.

To make the process as easy as possible for you, I have reviewed all the information already available to us, including from our approved public sources. However, we need your assistance obtaining the information detailed in the attached document, under the heading Client letter.

Our KYC requirements reflect our unique global footprint and risk appetite, so they may differ from other financial institutions, and may vary slightly from your last review.

Id really appreciate it if you could provide this information by 22/08/2025.

Depending on the responses received, I may need you to provide other information and documentation, but I will let you know if this is the case, along with what is required .

Of course, feel free to ask me or your relationship director any questions you might have about this process  were here to help.

Thank you for your support.

Kind regards,

Thanks & Regards,

Rajesh Karri |KYC Senior Analyst | Corporate KYC | BARCLAYS

messages.subject: Items for Director discussion monday
messages.body:
Hi Jay,


Next week.


I need to complete board papers for Douglas 1200hrs mon
I have a 0900hrs with Anders. Focus on 2 x board meetings I suspect.
Deadline for grow strategy Stena Line board COB Tue
Deadline for Stena BV report COB Wed.
I want to attend part of dev meeting Monday am.


Then catch up with you. 1030-1230 Monday ?? Ish pending above.


Just getting some items on paper, in no order priority. If we agree to proceed, we move to SMT discussion / strategy. I am not saying get an outcome, but we commit to the action.


 1.  Pay bonus for in office 4 days plus. 1% increase paid monthly to anyone who attends in office 4 days or more. Must commit to a 6 month block
 2.  Salary structure for CS freightlink and customslink. High turnover CS staff. My calcs 16.5k year 1 to train a CS team member. Project to increase start salary to 24500 - my gut tells me 26 mid year we need to be at 26-27k for a good standard of employee - I want to hand this to Steph as a project
 3.  Sales training plan - where are we struggling JM / external?
 4.  Reload / Contract L recovery plan
 5.  Monika role - MS JM private
 6.  John future discussion strategy - we cannot have John holding us to handsome. In board meeting we will.be proposing Ops Director. This is not John. We need someone with an eye for detail and writing OLA and driving performance. Fall out etc
 7.  Ste - marketing how did 121 go ? Update.
 8.  Matt & CL - update. How do get him to own more ? We need to set expectations.
 9.  Accounts - some KPI on credit checks KRD.
 10. Report writing - We need some resources here ? I have spent an obscene amount of time writing board papers and others coming up. Catherine ? Frank ?
 11. Jen new role - exit strategy to back fill.
 12. Items board papers- all agree
 13. EU employees - we need ROI employee, so we need a solution. I have an idea to employ through other Baltress or Sembo. We cannot do it through Stena Line. Conflict of interest.
 14. Meeting for disaster recovery. We went into this mode on Friday. Observations - a) Jen got hammered. She is coming out of this role. How do we back fill ? b) We were far too late getting message out to clients. c) We need a backup to emails - what's app ? Risk another channel for FL CL to manage d) we need to have a "command" channel to coordinate e) matt was far to slow at raising concerns f) your thoughts
 15. You said there will be be more staff leave ?? Where
 16. Your MBO. We need clarity for any bonus end of year. I dont want either of us in a difficult position so I want absolute clarity.

Just a bit of a brain dump. May add to this.
 17. 
     
 18. 
     



BR
Mark Stephens
Managing Director
M +44 (0) 779 320 4440

messages.subject: Re: Items for Director discussion monday
messages.body:
Notes made actions agreed



1. Pay bonus for in office 4 days plus. 1% increase paid monthly to anyone who attends in office 4 days or more. Must commit to a 6 month block  SMT discussion

2. Salary structure for CS freightlink and customslink. High turnover CS staff. My calcs 16.5k year 1 to train a CS team member. Project to increase start salary to 24500 - my gut tells me 26 mid year we need to be at 26-27k for a good standard of employee - I want to hand this to Steph as a project SMT discussion

3. Sales training plan - where are we struggling JM / external?  Done JM to action as he sees fit to manage the sales team until the end of the year  target is to achieve budget  check in 2 weeks MS / JM

4. Reload / Contract L recovery plan John off sales focus 100% on Realod / Contract logictics. Departments merge JG will take over Reload. Discussions w/c 08th Sept. Announce to the business w/c 15th Sept

5. Monika role - MS JM private Monika new role a) Partners b) Reporting sales c) Zoen leads d) JM/MS support e) Contact point for sales  JM to write NEW JD asap

6. John future discussion strategy - we cannot have John holding us to handsome. In board meeting we will.be proposing Ops Director. This is not John. We need someone with an eye for detail and writing OLA and driving performance. Fall out etc - Meeting today to outline we believe in JG. We want to invest in JG & the Realod product fully. KPI for director role 1) Must hit new agreed targets 2) Personal development (acting like a director) 3) Strategic planning 4) Ownership  Full meeting agreed Thu 04th Sept.

7. Ste - marketing how did 121 go ? Update. Friday MS comments 1) All business support online etc must be visual and easy to digest 2) Translate the words into what this means for our customers. Follow the process 3) Must be factually correct 4) Design work go to ICG other than small things which we can manage internally. JM to discuss with Ste

8. Matt & CL - update. How do get him to own more ? We need to set expectations.- In Matt 121  MS he MUST take ownership, stop being a passenger

9. Accounts - some KPI on credit checks KRD.  MS when KRD MS to take up with Catherine needs resolving urgently

10. Report writing - We need some resources here ? I have spent an obscene amount of time writing board papers and others coming up. Catherine ? Frank ? No  support specific work MS will communicate

11. Jen new role - exit strategy to back fill.  Anna / Dan K to Jack  Agreed MS discuss with Jen and Jack timing

12. Items board papers- all agree & sent

13. EU employees - we need ROI employee, so we need a solution. I have an idea to employ through other Baltress or Sembo. We cannot do it through Stena Line. Conflict of interest. Board discussion.

14. Meeting for disaster recovery. We went into this mode on Friday. Observations - a) Jen got hammered. She is coming out of this role. How do we back fill ? b) We were far too late getting message out to clients. c) We need a backup to emails - what's app ? Risk another channel for FL CL to manage d) we need to have a "command" channel to coordinate e) matt was far to slow at raising concerns f) your thoughts Discuss on HOT meeting

15. You said there will be be more staff leave ?? Where ? Just disgruntled people.

16. Your MBO. We need clarity for any bonus end of year. I dont want either of us in a difficult position so I want absolute clarity.  MBO as is stand minus Customs service. MS to put in place 2nd bonus to be agreed with JM by end of week

17. HOT all in, in person for HOT day. SMT

18. Have a monthly "team day" where everyone comes in, even early shifts. We provide lunch ? Tie in with a standup SMT  monthly / per quarter SMT

19. Restructure Dan K and Ana to Jack (product owners). Fiona Data team report Catherine end of year ?

20. Agree SMT agenda. I will email separately. Done

Just a bit of a brain dump. May add to this.

21. 

22. 



BR

Mark Stephens

Managing Director

messages.subject: Reload 2026 & personal terms - Confidential
messages.body:
Hi Kevin,
Thank you again for your time yesterday.
As discussed, due to a combination of factors, our volumes and gross profit will fall short of the 2025 budget. This unfortunately means were not in a position to increase any packages or costs at this time. The business is reliant on achieving its budget targets.
We shared our 2026 budget plans with you, which I trust you agree are realistic and take into account the challenges your team has faced this year. The budget reflects the current run rate with a 10% uplift, and youll also benefit from any retained work from Contract Logistics following Johns departure.
Your continued commitment and support in delivering this plan is essential. You've made it clear that you do not wish to proceed with hiring a new BDM at this stage, and we respect that decision. You know your clients and market better than anyone, and we support your approach. However, its vital that we see a clear recovery plan that drives growth.
I was encouraged to hear that you and your team will take ownership of generating new sales. As you know, weve struggled to deliver on this front in recent years, and we must avoid repeating that pattern in 2026.
To support this, we need to agree on a set of key KPIs that you and the team are fully aligned with. If we fall short of these KPIs, we must be prepared to adjust our strategy. We cannot afford to persist with a plan that isnt delivering results. If something isnt working, we need to fix itquickly and decisively.
These KPIs will primarily focus on new business development and sales growth. Lets work together to ensure we have a robust framework in place to track and drive performance.
In recognition of your support and the extra hard work you will undertake in 2026, we will adjust your package as follows:-


 * Current salary  47,550.00 plus bonus
 * Monthly bonus 2025 (amended immediately) on target  300 per month (as discussed Jay will agree these with you)
 * 01st Jan 2026  51,500.00 (10.5% /  3950)



For 2026, we will also amend your monthly targets as follows. This provides you with an easier initial target to hit (on budget), plus the ability to earn considerably more bonus as your overachieve.



Kevin

Month GP

Quarter GP

Annual GP

Annualised bonus if all achieved

Budget

This is a substantial step forward and underlines our support of you. This must also be seen as a stepped change in not just your effort but your continued growth in professionalism. Jay, Steph and myself are committed to supporting you to not only achieve the above, but also your personal growth goals.


Before we put this increase formally in writing from the business, I would like you to confirm we have your full commitment going forward.


Best Regards
Mark Stephens

From: Stephanie Newsham <Stephanie@freightlink.co.uk>
Date: Thursday, 11 September 2025 at 14:56
To: Aneta Misztal <Aneta@freightlink.co.uk>, Catherine Taylor <Catherine@freightlink.co.uk>, Fiona Martin <fiona@freightlink.co.uk>, Ivan Mudry <Ivan@freightlink.co.uk>, Jack Caldwell <Jack@freightlink.co.uk>, Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>, Jennifer Sharpe <Jennifer.Sharpe@customs-link.com>, John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>, Kevin Tracey <Kevin@freightlink.co.uk>, Mark Stephens <mark@freightlink.co.uk>, Matthew Jackson <Matthew.Jackson@customs-link.com>, Michael <Michael@freightlink.co.uk>, Stephanie Newsham <Stephanie@freightlink.co.uk>, Stephen Smith <Stephen@freightlink.co.uk>, Tom Crawley <Tom@freightlink.co.uk>, Tracey Sunbul <Tracey.Sunbul@customs-link.com>
Subject: New Performance Process & PIP

Hi everyone



I hope you're well.



As part of our commitment to maintaining a consistent and supportive approach to performance management across the business, we are introducing a revised performance process that includes both informal and formal stages, along with a newPerformance Improvement Plan (PIP)template, both attached to this email.



As mentioned in my presentation back in June at the Away Day, its really important thatall stages of the process are followed carefully and documented in writing. This ensures we are fair and consistent in our approach, and that any performance concerns are addressed as early and effectively as possible.



Key Points:



 Informal Stage: This is the first step where concerns are raised and discussed constructively with the employee. Its an opportunity to provide support and set clear expectations, and ideally, nip any issues in the bud. This stage is carried out by you, as the line manager, but Im always here to guide and support where needed.

 Formal Stage: If performance does not improve following the informal stage, the formal process should be initiated, using the PIP to outline specific objectives, timelines and support measures.



If you If you have any questions or need support in implementing the process, please dont hesitate to reach out.



Thank you for your attention to this.



Steph





E:Stephanie@freightlink.co.uk

T: 07540 751287

W:freightlink.co.uk

A:12 Sceptre Court, Bamber Bridge, Preston, PR5 6AW, UK.



Steph Newsham

Head of HR

I have done some digging here. I don't think we are bound to supplying some off the documents requested:- IN RED


I DSAR request is personal data - obv this included emails etc TO him where we have asked him to act upon something.



 My complete employee file.

 Performance: All records relating to my performance. This includes performance reviews, all one-to-one meeting records (121s), including dates of submission, performance improvement plans, disciplinary records, and any other documentation relating to my work performance.

 Support and Guidance: All documents that have been used to guide or support my work and development. This includes training materials, policy documents, emails providing guidance and procedural explanations/guidelines, and any other relevant materials.

 All communications, documentation, and correspondence: This includes all emails, text messages, instant messages, and any other form of electronic or written communication concerning me and my work whether they reference me directly or indirectly.



In accordance with GDPR, I request:



 That this information is provided in a clear and easily understandable format within the statutory timeframe.

 Details of any recipients or categories of recipients to whom my data has been disclosed.

 Information on the purposes for which my data is being processed.

 The envisaged retention period for my data, or the criteria used to determine that period.



Please confirm receipt of this request and kindly let me know at the earliest opportunity if you require any further details to identify the data.



Thank you for your cooperation.



Sincerely, 

John Gaskell



Sent from Outlook for Mac

messages.subject: DSAR DRAFT
messages.body:
Dear John
We are writing to confirm that the timeframe for responding to your Data Subject Access Request (DSAR) has been extended by two months, in accordance with Article 12(3) of the UK GDPR, which permits an extension where requests are complex or numerous.
This extension is necessary for several reasons:
 1. Change in Request Status: During our meeting on [date], you indicated that you intended to withdraw your DSAR. It was only on [date] that you confirmed your decision to proceed, which has impacted our ability to progress within the original timeframe.
 2. Scope of the Request: Your DSAR is broad and non-specific, resulting in an exceptionally large volume of data being identified. The proportion of this data that contains personal information is relatively small compared to standard business communications you were already privy to. See below specific information
 3. Redaction Requirements: A significant portion of the data includes confidential customer and supplier information, as well as details relating to other team members. This requires extensive redaction to protect third-party rights and confidentiality, which is a time-intensive process.
 4. Resource Constraints: The Christmas period has reduced the availability of both internal resources and those of our third-party providers, further contributing to the complexity of fulfilling your request promptly.

Please be assured that we have maintained a detailed record of all actions taken to obtain relevant data, including MS Exchange and MS Teams content from Evolve, and have sought legal advice to ensure compliance throughout this process.
We remain committed to completing your request as soon as possible and will keep you updated on progress.
We are able to provide the following information:-
 1. Extract board papers Sept 25
 2. Extract board papers Nov 25
 3. Email requesting you to join SMT
 4. Email following acceptance to join the SMT
 5. Email from you confirming you would like to be withdrawn from sales and SMT
 6. 121 copies / personnel files
 7. Director career development plan

We are committed to delivering the DSAR request. If you are able to reduce the scope of the DSAR this will facilitate an improved timeline example between XXX - YYY dates, specific people. This would narrow the scope of your request to expedite the process.


The first search criteria:-


John Gaskell or JG or John@freightlink.co.uk
AND Message Kind contains any IM (Instant message) and Message Kind contains any of Microsoft Teams. (These help to export any information related to Teams); Date anything after 1st January 2023
OR
Participant contains any of john@freightlink.co.uk
Recipients contains any of john@freightlink.co.uk
Sender contains any of john@freightlink.co.ukwith all item's containing "John Gaskell"


Results - 200GB of data. Based upon most of the email / teams correspondence being text, this is over 100 million pages of emails. Within this data, the vast majority of emails / team which do not contain personal data, only business emails.


John@freightlink.co.uk
AND Message Kind contains any IM (Instant message) and Message Kind contains any of Microsoft Teams. (These help to export any information related to Teams); Date anything after 1st January 2023
OR
Recipients contains any of john@freightlink.co.uk
Sender contains any of john@freightlink.co.uk


Results - 20GB of data. Based upon most of the email / team's correspondence being text, this is over 10 million pages of emails. Again, within this data, the vast majority of emails / team which do not contain personal data, only business emails.






Best Regards
Mark Stephens


E: mark@freightlink.co.uk
T: + 44 (0) 779 320 4440
W: www.freightlink.co.uk






MARK STEPHENS

Director

Cc: Mark Stephens <mark@freightlink.co.uk>, Jason Mayor <jason@freightlink.co.uk>, Alex McDonald <Alex@freightlink.co.uk>, Daniel Kelecsenyi <Daniel.Kelecsenyi@customs-link.com>
Subject: IMPORTANT PLEASE READ: SSGB > FL Customers

Hi all



We are planning to go live with S&S GB for FL web customers w/c 20th Jan ready for 31st January.

We plan on going live with the Partner sites the following week w/c 27th Jan and being fully ready for the managed service. 



Terminology Updates:

ENS (S&S GB) - 5 or 6

ENS (ICS 2/EU) - for both N. Sea mandatory ENS and MRN ENS for EU which we don't currently sell in FL (we do sell on CL).



@Stephen Smith is currently updating the S&S GB website page which will contain walk through video guide for customers on completing ENS. 



Digital service: Customer create their own S&S GB

Managed service: Customer requests from FL CS  Credit account customers ONLY at the moment.



S&S GB Booking Journey  Digital Service

Dev updates still required atm (WHAT) but I want you all to get a better understanding early this week.

Further training will be provided so all understand the full process and how errors are handled between CL/FL including the managed service we are offering.

Will get you looking at the test environments ASAP (I just want a few things updated first)



 FL Web Booking Details page > Customer will have option to purchase ENS (S&S GB) Lets stick with the terminology, it will note 5 or 6 (ignore 7.50 on screenshot)







NE W DEV If customer logged into their CREDIT account they will see an additional banner on booking details page (unable to purchase this service on website, need to contact CS directly). 

Price TBC for managed S&S GB service







 Customer selects S&S GB ENS > price updated, customer then continues to confirm booking

 Data lands in F2, basic tab check box MRN ENS is automatically selected and notes tab updated, email sent to customer to complete their ENS.

(you will have to select MRN ENS if creating booking manually). F2 Customs tab status changed to requested















 Lassie Admin updated with job

Important note for FL CS: we need to start using the lassie ENS dashboard to monitor status of all ENSs

 New fields added: Type, If Empty and CL reference number

 Status can be manually updated if required inside each ENS  this needs to be used for N. Sea ENS (DFDS/P&O), Stena will automatically update to processed as it sent via EDI

 Ability to filter on Type which will help CS manage/check the 3 types of ENSs in place (N. Sea ENS, MRN ENS and Managed MRN ENS)









 Complete your ENS email sent to customer







 Customer clicks on ENS Link > Customer fills out details, submits

  Booking details will be pre-populated on behalf of the customer from F2, they will need to fill out:

o Vehicle Details (Haulier EORI/address)

o Countries travelling through

o Consignment Information  they can add multiple consignments

 Shipper/Consignor (address mandatory, EORI optional)

 Recipient/Consignee (address mandatory, EORI optional)

 Package info (Packaging Type/Shipper marks/Quantity/goods descriptions/gross weight/if hazardous)

















 The data is sent to CL to process

The ENS will also be assigned a CL job reference number so we can track in both FL and CL systems.



 Error handling

CL CS tracks and fixes the errors from 2020/CL Platform

If there is a genuine rejection  CL CS will notify FL CS > FL CS will update lassie with specific errors and customer will receive an email to recomplete their ENS then submit

More details to come on this topic so all teams understand

This should be used for N. Sea ENS errors too









 S&S GB Accepted

Completed ENS email to customer with MRN

Lassie updated with Processed and CL reference number and S&S GB MRN number 

F2 customs tab updated with S&S GB MRN ENS number and CL ref number

Once all customs info completed, Customs Info Status changed to complete







There will be lots of queries, @Ivan Mudry @Aneta Misztal @John Gaskell please collate these and we can discuss together.



I have not updated the complete journey for the Managed service, stay tuned 



Kind regards

Jenny
